title: Girl, woman released from hospital after shooting in Milwaukee
content:
A 3-year-old girl and 23-year-old woman wounded by gunfire Wednesday night have been released from the hospital, Milwaukee police said Thursday.
The shooting, reported shortly before 9 p.m. in the 3800 block of W. Fairmount Ave., stemmed from an argument among a group of people, according to police.
Officials say they are continuing to investigate the motive behind the shooting and offered no further details about the possible subject of the argument.
The girl, who suffered a graze wound, is not related to the woman who was injured, but police said the woman is friends with the girl's father.
No arrests had been made as of Thursday morning, and police continued to search for suspects.
